description: From Middle English overliven, from Old English oferlibban (“to survive”), equivalent to over- +‎ live. Cognate with Dutch overleven (“to survive”), German überleben (“to survive, outlive”), Swedish överleva (“to survive, outlive, outlast”).

verbs.description: overlive (third-person singular simple present overlives, present participle overliving, simple past and past participle overlived)

examples: [M]y disease cannot survive me, I may overlive it.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To live too fast, too luxuriously, or too actively.
